title: Can We Have a Counter On Malzahar too show when his voidling will die?
body:
Do you have have that moment as malz wen you go into a teamfight and all your spells are on Cd because you just fought the enemy yasuo?
and then you go into the teamfight undertower at low health and you think your voidling will live long enough to tank the tower 
and suddenly your voidling dies and your tanking the tower for your team at 50 hp?
well my proposal is to have a counter to show how long until your voidling will die.

replies.body:
I voted no; first, if you click the voidling you can tell how much time is left (the rapidly decreasing buff it has is that time), second, after it's arms start glowing it has 7 seconds left. If the arms are glowing, maybe think twice about engaging.

Otherwise, if you had 50 health and decided to go attack a turret with only a glowy armed voidling as company you deserved to die.
If you play Malzahar enough you get to know how long your Voidlings will be up, and the fact that they do have stages of growing up, it does tell you how long they have left in existence.

but just like they did do the jungle monsters 
they put there health above there head so you don't have to always click on them to see there health
I just want a timer so I don't always have to click the voidlings

> [{quoted}](name=mobius1galm16,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=eAzVLEwy,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2014-12-29T03:43:13.894+0000)
>
> but just like they did do the jungle monsters 
> they put there health above there head so you don't have to always click on them to see there health
> I just want a timer so I don't always have to click the voidlings

That was specifically for the big jungle buffs though, not the smaller ones or other camps. Voidlings are not a once every 5 minutes buff that grant great rewards; they are extremely transient squishy beasts. In addition, a timer still wouldn't be helpful there, since they also have hp (I suppose you could do the Shaco box thing, but that would add a LOT of visual clutter for a pet that is almost entirely ignored except on AD malzahar).
